j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:10): hi all, i try to use xwiki watch, but I get "Exception while dispatching incoming RPC call"  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:10): my config is XWIKI ENTERPRISE 1.9.1.21780, latest jar and xar for xwiki watch  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:11): hi j-saturne  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:11): hi lucaa  
asyd - (04/08/2009 10:12): hello lucaa, you're the one working on watch, right? :P  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:12): by latest jar and .xar you mean the latest releases? (from the download page) 1.1-m1?  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:12): hi asyd. Yes  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:12): yes  
asyd - (04/08/2009 10:12): is there a beta xar available for latests version of xwiki? :)  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:13): actually, for the 1.8.4 + versions of enterprise you will have to use a watch snapshot from the repository, to be released as a 1.1-m2.  
asyd - (04/08/2009 10:14): oh, ok, need to find it  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:14): lemme find the maven builds for you (and update the installation page on watch.xwiki.org)  
asyd - (04/08/2009 10:14): thanks  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 10:14  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:17): lucaa : thanks !  
rrodriguez\_\_ left at 10:17 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:18  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:21): j-saturne: will take a while, I need to ask our continuos integration server to rebuild that. If you want, you can get the sources and build it yourself. Note, however, that the recommended enterprise version for this snapshot is 1.8.4. It will mainly work on a 1.9.1 too, but some issues might appear.  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:25): lucaa : I prefer get xar/jar, because I don't have a good build environnement for xwiki (tools, ...), if this is not a problem to go with the  continuous integration server, It's more simple for me. For 1.8.4, I know that, it's just a test with xwiki/watch  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:38): j-saturne: here you go: xar: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-wikis-watch/1.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-watch-wikis-watch-1.1-20090804.082446-1.xar client jar: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-gwt-client/1.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-watch-gwt-client-1.1-20090804.082446-1.jar server jar: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-gwt-server/1.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-watch-gwt-serv  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:39): lucaa : thks !  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:40): lucaa : last url it not good  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:41): j-saturne: wdym?   
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:42): lucaa : http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-gwt-server/1.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-watch-gwt-serv is broken  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:42): server jar: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-watch-gwt-server/1.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-watch-gwt-server-1.1-20090804.082446-1.jar  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:42): ok  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:43): probably the message didn't get through enire  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:43): entire  
asyd - (04/08/2009 10:43): there is xar release?  
asyd - (04/08/2009 10:43): +no  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:47): lucaa : it works :)  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:47): lucaa : where can I add a feed ?  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:49): go to the watch reader (if you're not already there)  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:49): view/Watch/Reader?xpage=plain ?  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:50): yes  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:50): in the left column, there is a little gear wheel where you can configure your reader. You need to have edit rights on the Watch space to be able to add feeds  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:50): (Admin / admin should work on a default enterprise)  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:50): it's empty (only header : XWiki logo and footer (licensed ..) ). none hyperlink   
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:51): mmh...  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:51): reload  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:51): :)  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:51): (i've seen this before, it's a bug I need to investigate thoroughly)  
j-saturne - (04/08/2009 10:51): it works, sorry  
lucaa - (04/08/2009 10:51): oki

tachirei - (04/08/2009 12:29): hi!  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 12:30): Hi tachirei  
tachirei - (04/08/2009 12:30): can anyone give me an example of a public xwiki site who use a lot of SSX, please? I want to get an idea about how the clients are using the StyleSheetExtension objects: how many objects, how many CSS classes & ids, etc.  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 12:31): xwiki.com  
tachirei - (04/08/2009 12:31): :))

tachirei - (04/08/2009 12:32): thanks!

asyd - (04/08/2009 15:47): who may I disturb few minutes about best pratices while developing an application using xwiki? :)  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:53  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 15:55): Hi asyd  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 15:55): Go on  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:56): well, for example, where to put classes? I guess it's better if I leave the XWiki spaces unchanged?  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 15:57): Yes  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:57): ok  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:57): hmm, it's impossible to delete a properties?  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:57): +still  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 15:57): It would be better to put the classes in a space named after the goal of the application  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:57): ok, well, mine will use lot of spaces  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 15:58): Yes, but hopefully not for long  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 15:58): 2.0 will have this feature  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:58): mm ok  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:59): I notice there is already a 2.0 milestone  
asyd - (04/08/2009 15:59): maybe I should use it to start my develpoment?  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 16:00): There aren't many differences between the current 2.0 milestones and 1.9  
asyd - (04/08/2009 16:00): ok  
asyd - (04/08/2009 16:00): hmm, what others informations should be useful  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 16:01): But you minght be interested to know that the final 2.0 will have a new skin  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 16:01): \*might  
sdumitriu - (04/08/2009 16:01): That it's supposed to be easier to customize  
asyd - (04/08/2009 16:16): oh, nice1
